metadata.Title: CVE-2012-3509 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
Multiple integer overflows in the (1) _objalloc_alloc function in objalloc.c and (2) objalloc_alloc macro in include/objalloc.h in GNU libiberty, as used by binutils 2.22, allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via vectors related to the "addition of CHUNK_HEADER_SIZE to the length," which triggers a heap-based buffer overflow.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-3509` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

binutils - 2.24-5ubuntu3
binutils-multiarch - 2.24-5ubuntu3
binutils-source - 2.24-5ubuntu3
binutils-static - 2.24-5ubuntu3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: binutils package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.24-5ubuntu3').
